item.title: How to use i18n in golang?
item.author: Juan Machuca
item.description: Internationalization (i18n) is essential for creating applications that can be used in different languages and regions around the world. In Golang, i18n refers to the process of creating applications that can adapt to different languages, cultures, and regions so that users can effectively interact with them regardless of their location or native language. To achieve this, Golang provides a standard package called “i18n” that allows developers to internationalize their applications effectively.

item.title: Let's talk about gorutines
item.author: Juan Gabriel Machuca
item.description: I have to say that my relationship with the goruntins not is the bests, However, I am deeply attracted to gorutins. Ok, let’s skip the romantic part and get down to the nitty-gritty. I have a dream I have a dream? Yes, this question should be “I have a problem”, but it’s not enought funny to admit that I do. In an ideal world I would have a lot of heavy tasks, running concurrently that I could cancel at any time, without worrying about memory leaks, race conditions or synchronization scheduling.
